Too Much Noise
By Noni
One day, Sringeri Srinivas
set out for the cattle fair
with his best cows.
They had to go
on the new national highway.
The cars and trucks had very loud horns.
Paoon! Ponn! Pa!
The cows did not like the noise at all.
They forced Sringeri Srinivas
to take them back home.
But the noise
stayed inside Sringeri Srinivas's head
and came back home with him.
Even the sounds
that Sringeri Srinivas heard daily
suddenly became too loud for him.
The frogs, the koyals, the cows, the tiger.
Why were they so noisy?
Poor Sringeri Srinivas.
He only wanted silence.
He shouted at the children
if they talked loudly.
Everyone tried to help.
The children played cricket quietly.
The cows did not moo any more.
Yet Sringeri Srinivas was not happy.
"I will go away from this noisy place,"
he declared one morning.
He walked away from his village
and reached a new town,
which was even noisier.
He met a young man
wearing headphones,
who seemed very happy,
in spite of all the honking.
"Aha, this is just what I need," he said.
He bought a big pair of headphones.
No more noise!
Now, when Sringeri Srinivas
gets very angry at the cars or the frogs,
he just puts on his headphones
and listens to some quiet music.
But he still has to take his cows
to the cattle fair along the noisy highway.
Maybe his cows need headphones too!
